value: Oysters and other food in Coffin Bay

The bay's name is another legacy of Matthew Flinders, who named the town after his friend Sir Isaac Coffin.

The town has calm water, boating and fishing.  It is a popular summer tourist destination on the peninsula.
Coffin Bay is just off the Flinders Highway and is well signposted from
and surrounding areas. There is no public transport to Coffin Bay. The closest airport and coach service is in Port Lincoln, where you can hire a car. Coffin Bay is around 8 hours drive from

There is a nice walkway around the shoreline. 
There is no public transport.

Ocean view in Coffin Bay Park
content=Coffin Bay National Park is to the west of the town.

is to the east. The Coffin Bay National Park has a diverse coastal landscape with high windswept cliffs, sand dunes, sheltered waters for boating and swimming and long white beaches. The parks are home to an abundance of birds, wildlife, wildflowers, sheoaks and black tea trees. You need to buy a ticket when entering.

20 km of sealed road leading outward from the town entrance provides easy access to picturesque local destinations.

There is an ATM in the general store, which will dispense up to $200.
